info.title: Compass
info.description: Documentation of our Compass API with gRPC and gRPC-Gateway.

get.description: Returns list of assets, optionally filtered by types, services, sorting, fields in asset.data and querying fields

400.description: Returned when the data that user input is wrong.

404.description: Returned when the resource does not exist.

409.description: Returned when the resource already exist.

500.description: Returned when theres is something wrong on the server side.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: sorting direction can either be asc or desc

parameters.name: withTotal
parameters.description: if set include total field in response

get.description: API for querying documents. 'text' is fuzzy matched against all the available datasets, and matched results are returned. You can specify additional match criteria using 'filter.*' query parameters. You can specify each filter multiple times to specify a set of values for those filters. For instance, to specify two landscape 'vn' and 'th', the query could be `/search/?text=<text>&filter.environment=integration&filter.landscape=vn&filter.landscape=th`

400.description: Returned when the data that user input is wrong.

404.description: Returned when the resource does not exist.

409.description: Returned when the resource already exist.

500.description: Returned when theres is something wrong on the server side.

parameters.name: rankby
parameters.description: descendingly sort based on a numeric field in the record. the nested field is written with period separated field name. eg, "rankby[data.profile.usage_count]"

400.description: Returned when the data that user input is wrong.

404.description: Returned when the resource does not exist.

500.description: Returned when theres is something wrong on the server side.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

 The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.
